title: Jobe Murphy
text:
Jobe Murphy (born 16 October 1992 in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>, England) is an English-born <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>. He primarily plays , and previously played for the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
Bradford Bulls.
2012 - <a href="2012%20Bradford%20Bulls%20season">2012 Season</a>
Murphy featured on the bench in the pre-season games against <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> and <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>. He was promoted to a starting second row spot in the friendly against <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley Cougars</a>.
2013 - <a href="2013%20Bradford%20Bulls%20season">2013 Season</a>
Murphy featured in the two pre-season friendlies against <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a> and <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a>.
He made his début in Round 3 (<a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a>). He featured in three consecutive games from Round 6 (<a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a>) to Round 8 (<a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a>). He was released at the end of the season.
Dewsbury Rams.
Murphy was dual registered with <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a> for the 2013 season. He featured against <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a>, <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a>, <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> and <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton Lions</a>.
At the end of the 2014 season, Jobe played for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> in the <a href="2014%20European%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">2014 European Cup</a> tournament.
In early pre-season 2015, Jobe failed to show up to trainings and therefore had his contract terminated by head coach <a href="Glenn%20Morrison">Glenn Morrison</a>. It was found out he 'privately' quit rugby league due to increased work commitments.
